extraction_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

AT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with HCC with evidence of a survival benefit from TACE versus supportive therapy (BSC)
patients with HCC with evidence of a survival benefit from TACE versus supportive therapy (BSC)

DE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with HCC with evidence of a survival benefit from TACE versus supportive therapy (BSC)
patients with HCC with evidence of a survival benefit from TACE versus supportive therapy (BSC)

DK.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma with preserved hepatic function and in good general condition where resection, transplantation, ablation or TACE/ SIRT cannot be performed or are not expected to have an effect, or for patients with additional hepatic disease
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma in good performance with good liver function
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma in good performance with good liver function
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma in good performance with good liver function
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma in good performance with good liver function
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma in good performance with good liver function
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma with limited multifocal disease and if the patient does not tolerate systemic therapy

ES.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: advanced disease, systemic treatment should be offered to patients with ECOG/PS 0-1 and Child–Pugh class A

EU.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

FR.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma
patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma who progressed on sorafenib treatment
patients with advanced and progressing hepatocellular carcinoma
patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma and increased alpha-fetoprotein concentrations after sorafenib
patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma previously treated with sorafenib

IT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced and/or unresectable HCC
patients with advanced and/or unresectable HCC
patients with advanced HCC and Child-Pugh B liver cirrhosis
patients with HCC and Child-Pugh C liver cirrhosis for whom transplantation is not possible

NL.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who had not received previous systemic therapy
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who had not received previous systemic therapy
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who have failed or are not eligible for local treatment options
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who have failed or are not eligible for local treatment options
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who have received prior sorafenib

PO.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with non-surgical hepatocellular carcinoma in good general condition and with good liver function (Child and Pugha Class A)
patients previously treated with Sorafenib with AFP ≥ 400 ng/ ml
patients who have previously received bevacizumab with atezolizumab
patients who have previously received bevacizumab with atezolizumab
patients who have previously received bevacizumab with atezolizumab

SE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced HCC, such as metastasis or malignancy, taking into account overall cardiac function, liver disease and co-morbidity
